name: Fortix 2
description: Fortix 2 is best described as a reverse turret defense game. As Sir Fortix, the knight, you must conquer castles while dodging tower turrets and evil monsters. Fight your way across the shires of the island Artalom, storming from castle to castle.

reviews.review_text: This game is sooo enjoyable! its also srsly a good choice if you dont want to use your mouse! I play it on my toaster lap top, it works smoothly and its alot of fun. For those older gamers if you remember the game called 'JezzBall', well this is the improved version of that one :) Its 1$ at the moment and its more than worth it!

A fresh take on the classic Jezzball formula. Extremely entertaining and fun. The first game has a kind of bland color set but it still quite fun. This sequel is nice and bright, has a fairly decent 'plot', very good levels, and nice graphics. Highly recommended!
A lot of fun, even somewhat addicting! Has more depth and sophistication than the first game in the series, but it's still very simple and intuitive.
A cheap to buy game with trading cards the graphics and sound do their job and the gameplay is quite fun while it lasts.
This is a fine little game, and is very similar to Gals Panic of the old arcade days. Runs perfectly on my underpowered netbook too.
This is a wee gem of a game. Qix with dragons & catapults. Easy to learn, great difficulty curve, and a steady stream of new toys/mechanics. A bargain at $2.

Fortix 2 has built on the successful gameplay of the prequel adding some new features.It takes a formula pioneered decades ago, puts a fantasy story and theme over it, and perfects the concept with clever and challenging level design.It's an easy pick-up-and-drop game that's fun for all ages.
simple, fun, good graphic. Lovely game :D
This game is easy to play, simple, yet fun. Highly recommended for those who are looking for casual game to kill some time.
very entertaining and strategic game. but can be hard as hell sometimes. it also contains all maps from part 1!
A simple boring flash game you'll get for free on a flash game website.

A fun game that requires different approaches on the different difficulty levels, and leaves me wanting to play just a little bit more. The depth may be limited but it's worth a dollar or two, which is thankfully all it costs.
spent $1 on this game and got hours and hours of fun out of it.

This is one of my old favourites from the Amiga days. At first glance it does not look addictive but when you start play a map you cant really stop playing before you have completed it with a perfect score. Or at least i cant ;) If you want a game that you can play now and then for fun, this will surely be one of them.

Fun game, takes an old mechanic and adds some new things, like different type of enemies, powerups, and you don't win by capturing 100% of the scrren but by capturing specific targets. I particulary enjoyed a couple of achievements that required some thought and skill (finishing a level without using cannons and finishing a leven in less than 10 captures), I think a few more of this challenges would be nice, maybe as challenges included in the game and not only as achievements. It's easy to understand and fun to play, recommended for anyone looking for some uncomplicated entertainment (it also includes classic levels, from Fortix 1, I assume).
Really addicting game. Concept is simple and the game is just long enough and varied where it does not become repetitive.  You definitely should consider purchasing it.

Still a great, fun game just like the first Fortix. Actually includes some improvements such as extra monsters, extra power-ups, and the option to replay a certain level in a stage as opposed to having to start all over if you die mid-way or at the final level (was very frustrating in Fortix 1). My only complaint is this: why the kiddy look in the sequel???? It almost looks as if they're imitating other kiddy-looking games such as Angry Birds and Candy Crush. It's a very drastic change from the original game, which had more of a medieval look to it. A very odd change in tone.  Aside from that, this game is excellent and the price is a steal.
Alright, I have to admit it, this is a great reinvention of Qix!

I bought this game as because it was interesting and on sale and i'm plesantly surprised. It's got a variety of difficulty levels and it was fun to play. Great puzzle game, cute graphics, and worked on my old gaming computer without freaking out.

Not quite sure why this game is addictive. If your the kind of person who has to have 3 stars on every level of angry birds.... this is the OC game for you. The thing that keeps me playing this game is getting those darn 3 stars to match for every level.   Gameplay: Use WASD or Arrow Keys to move around. Capture Land by connecting lines Repeat until you get 3 stars on every level!  Nice change of pace from my shooters and RTS games.

If anyone remembers JezzBall from the Microsoft Entertainment Pack, this game plays like an advanced version. With more objectives than just clearing the area past a certain percentage, Fortrix 2 is a simple puzzle game that is pretty easy to complete without too much trouble.

I had no expectations when i bought this game, except for nostalgia. It turned out to be really much fun. I have now spent more than 10 hours, and i have still much more to do. Buy it, you will be plesanty surprised!
